result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anderson L Hereford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anderson L Hereford in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Anderson L Hereford.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties need time to negotiate, requesting 45-60 days. If no resolution set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anderson L Hereford in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Anderson L Hereford. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Asking for 30-45 days. Case to be re-assigned. Clerk to contact parties with date. Minutes filed.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:16 PM Defendant Anderson L Hereford appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Anderson L Hereford. ADA  Herrmann  in court for the State.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting 2 weeks for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 2:19pm
Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anderson L Hereford in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Anderson L Hereford. Rights given and hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anderson L Hereford in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Anderson L Hereford. Attorney is not requesting a preliminary hearing at this time. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
